reviewContent: Avoid like the plague. Waiting for 3 hours with 2 people processing the entire queue. Absolutely ridiculous. Asked why it takes so long and all I got was. It’s like this everyday. Sort it out people

Was going to security with me husband and son, appreciate all airports have there own way od doing things, but the girl at the conveyor bell was extremely rude raised her voice when my husband put his shoes in tray instead of putting them directly on belt, I then said in a raised voice also will admit that ok we heard her, she was passed off that I had spoken up, call another lady over who then asked Mr where all the luggage mine I said no, she asked my husband were we together he said yes , then she looks at me and said so these are all yours, I said nope that my husband had his luggage and I had mine, it wasn't even that hard to explain, it was her attitude over the whole thing, even at check in no acknowledgement no please or thanks, I work in customer service and to say I'm astonished by the customer service at this airport, never again will I use this airport, and I've been to many but my god this was the worst airport I've ever been in, customer service so low.

Due to flight delay, we were very tight for our connection flight. Using JFK on connections, we were forced to leave the secure area going from T5 to T7. This required us to recheck in at airline and go through the security screening process a second time. Airline facilitated us, but security were the rudest, uncaring, belligerent staff I had ever encountered. They simply barked to get to the back of the queue, which was huge. Avoid JFK at all costs.

The airport staff very rude and like it is not enough the trauma we have to go through with the checking time; we also need to experience the TSA staff rudeness and lack of emphaty. It is just sad how horrible we are all turning to be as human.

It is specific for Delta Airline Check-in process staff at JFK airport! My flight was to Seattle on July 1, afternoon, ~4:00pm. I checked-in online before I headed to JFK Airpot and so I did not have too much time before departure time. In security check point, the officer told me that, the birth date in my ticket (My son booked the ticket for me. It is his/our fault, I know.) is not the same as that in my driver license. So he asked me to go back to the check-in point for correction. The waiting line in the check-in (Maybe most of them are for checking in baggages while I do not have.) that day is super long. If I lined up from the end, I probably I will miss the flight. So, I talked to staff around the check-in area. It was so crowded. Someone said, you go to there, pointing. Totally, I talked to 5 difference people around that area. Still no one is responsible for my issue. They were saying differently. It seems I have to line up from the end. In the end, I stick on one lady. She said, I understand your situation. I can do nothing about it. She hinted me I have to line up again. Finally, I have to cut into the line by some people's kindness to allow me to cut into the middle of the line. I am OK to line up, even it is long, if I did not check in online. I would leave more time to do that. My question is. For this kind of special situation, should Delta Airline have some specific rules to handle??? would you like the custom to miss their flight? Thanks!

The border control employees are some of the most unhappy, rude people I have ever encountered. Why anyone would want to employ these nasty, aggressive, individuals to not only protect our border, but to be the first face of America that visitors encounter upon arrival, is beyond me. It's as though all of them did their customer service training at the DMV. Ironically, most of the immigrants they are charged with preventing from entering the U.S. could probably do their job 10 times better. Do the reputation of the U.S. and New York City a favor. Fire this surly, attitude-y, chip-on-their-shoulders crew. I gave the queuing time a bad score, because the staff's yelling and rude behavior actually inhibits the smooth processing of entrants.

Border control absolute incompetent, unruly nightmare. Almost got crushed on the escalators because entire area was mobbed. Has to push my kids through the crowd so they didn’t get trapped and possibly injured as scores more people were pushed up the escalators behind us. There was one single staff member there to manage a crowd of hundreds, and he was nonsensical with his demands (“don’t merge!” - as if there was any semblance of lines that anyone could merge into), rude, and dictatorial. Lines weren’t moving at all; air conditioning wasn’t working; and invariably tempers began to flare in the confusion. I’d describe it as “third world” but most third world nations are better managed than this.

What a miserable set of entitled jobsworths! We don't expect TSA staff to be grinning from ear to ear all shift long but do they all have to be so overtly rude and miserable? Can they read? They presumably did not read the job description. They must all feel very satisfied on completion of their shifts when presumably they go home and inflict their miserable selves on their families. Dead behind the eyes, not a good look.

commentHeader: find a way to avoid this airport
reviewContent: If you can find a way to avoid this airport with the longest wait on earth and worst customer service you will thank me later. I had a connecting flight and I had to wait 2 hours to pass the CBP and then I had to pass again thru security check (over 2 hours) to get in my other plane - unbelievable.

This is worst airport I ever been too! So rude, not helpful, why have an atm that you can take out money but not put in! Cashless system is fast way to lose customers, should be more people that are certified in different languages to help instead of make fun of them. New York JFK is a shame of an airport.

Every time I go through JFK, there are always delays. I flew JetBlue from Paris to JFK, and ended up getting delayed more than five hours after already having a four hour layover for my connection to Boston, as well as having had a long flight. Airport was not clean and staff were very rude. TSA confiscated a bottle of rum my dad bought in France that had already been cleared by customs. There also were limited food and shopping options. The only positive experience was spending part of the layover at the TWA hotel. I will never fly through JFK again, and I highly advise anyone flying to this airport as well.

commentHeader: impressed by the service and facilities
reviewContent: This is specific to Terminal 7, used by Aer Lingus. On arrival, we were escorted from the plane to the immigration hall and being first in there was somewhat taken aback by the fact that it was devoid of passengers! We were through the line snake and out to collect baggage in under five minutes from entering. Our bags were on the line within a few minutes too and we were through the whole immigration process and out to the taxis very quickly and smoothly. Our departure experience was equally smooth. We had arrived very early due to transfer arrangements from our cruise and had to hang around for a couple of hours for the check-in desks to open. The area around the desks is quite sterile and functional and only one shop, on the lower arrivals level was available. Luckily it did sell snacks, and drinks as the one food outlet down there was closed. Once open the check-in and security process was very straightforward. T7 now has scanners where there is no requirement to take items out of your bag so that was very smooth, delayed only by the usual one or two who left items in their pockets, forgot to take jackets off and so forth. T7 is not overly big so nowhere is a long way, which is great. The usual shops for Duty Free and food and drink outlets were present and done well. This is our third time using this terminal with Aer Lingus and we continue to be impressed by the service and facilities.

Appallingly rude staff throughout, from TSA to Duty Free staff to Aer Lingus check-in staff. Horrible people employed to deal with customers who pay their wages. Have to say TSA at Terminal 5 O'Hare in Chicago a few years ago was much the same...don't do the job if you don't like doing the job. TSA was a total shambles (Term 7) on a busy Saturday afternoon - nobody gave a toss. And don't start me on the price of stuff in "Duty Free".

I flew back from France on a flight that returned and unloaded a bit late (close to midnight). I had six hours between the time I got off and to terminal 8 before my next flight, which would take me home (final destination). I had tried to go through security but the man at security rudely denied me by stating I was too early. I didn’t know there was a maximum amount of hours you could not check in. I did take the time to look this up in advance and couldn’t find anything. Six hours seemed common. Many people have layovers too short to check in to a hotel. I even looked into the sleep pods and mentioned this as a question. The peach of a worker replied “this isn’t a lodge.” Sorry, but my costly flights help pay for him to have a job. A little courtesy and kind explanation would go a long way. Then when I could finally go through security I noticed pure rudeness and power tripping. Workers snapping at people telling them to get moving through security and hurry up. It was 3:30AM. Chill. Have a coffee first. Something. So blown away. I will avoid this airport at all costs in the future.

commentHeader: worst airport I have ever been to
reviewContent: The worst airport I have ever been to. You spend hours at arrivals with absolutely no information given about how long you are going to be there. They said the wait was 60 minutes but hours later still queuing. No staff around to ask either.

My feedback will be redundant, for the prior reviews are spot-on. After an eight-hour flight from the UK to the US, my daughter and I were exhausted when we went through security a second time to make our connecting flight home. As others have indicated, the staff was completely rude, but what was more disturbing was an interaction between one TSA worker and my daughter. Because she misinterpreted his directions to get into the cattle stall queue, he was outright condescending. Such demeaning comments/interactions should be illegal.

What a lack of respect with travellers! Hours and hours at passport control. Just a bunch of officers to check hundreds of people. Connection flights missing, people feeling sick because of the ridiculous waiting time, rude/grumpy staff everywhere, and so on. I don't know what they think they are, there is definitely nothing attractive about coming to America! Horrendous experience again, avoid it if you can.

Horrendous TSA! I could write a few pages but all I can say is they are unbelievably rude and disrespectful. If I could never fly there again, I wouldn’t. The girls were just awful. They should never have been hired to work with the human population.

The absolute worst TSA experience I’ve had in my life. Had a 3 hour layover from Paris and ended up having to run to re-check our baggage and catch our connecting flight because we spent over two hours in this particular layer of hell. The staff act like they’re having one long temper tantrum after another. Sure I get that they probably deal with a lot of difficult people, but the goal should be to deescalate and not escalate situations. Especially routine ones, like traveler confusion and slow lines. The lady “helping” people get their stuff onto the belt was yelling, snapping at people and barking out orders that made no sense. She was holding onto bins as if she were trying to actually make it more difficult for people. Kept barking for people to “move it along”. I have reduced mobility and I told her it’s very hard for me to move fast without my proper footwear (which they made me remove). She actually bellowed at me that she wasn’t taking to me, she was talking to the person behind me. Zero empathy, complete nastiness. You could tell she was burnt out and over it. TSA should seriously have some sort of plan to rotate out employees who hit the wall and can no longer function on any given day. The lady who ended up physically checking my bag could barely articulate in English and I’m pretty sure it was her native language, as it is mine. She confiscated some of my food and when I asked she said it was because it was a “sprayyyyyyeee”. Took me three tries to realize she was trying to say “a spread”. The whole experience was so nasty my daughter actually burst into tears. Ironically, my partner got through with his own “spraee”/spread—they only confiscated mine. Making me wonder if this is all really just theater. Either way, this experience does not need to be made so horrid. The agents are awful but it makes me wonder what kind of support (if any) they’re getting from on high. To those people I say this—like it or not, TSA are ambassadors of the cities they work in. I’ve had better experiences with TSA around the world and have returned to those cities again and again. I have absolutely zero interest in ever connecting through JFK again. Newark is no picnic but if I had to pick, I’d chose it over this layer of hell.

Others have already said it but I’m genuinely considering flying into LaGuardia or Newark next time, despite the fact it would take me longer to get to my destination after landing. I travel a lot for work and barring none, JFK is the worst experience. Incredibly rude staff at TSA, horrible people making aside comments and barking orders at people. They don’t have enough staff so the queues are always horrendous - we made it to the airport with plenty of time and still were the last ones almost to board because the queues were so astronomical. No air conditioning so just stuck with no seating in a hot corridor for over an hour waiting to go through security. And we didn’t even check bags! I’m disgusted. Ruined the whole experience of flying. This airport has serious problems - puts me off coming here ever again.

A lot of your security people are unnecessarily abrupt in America. TSA at JFK take the award for being the rudest and most abusive, throwing tubs around, bullying everyone. I get it that you are over the many stupid people that you have to deal with daily but just get a new job please don’t take it out on everybody else.

commentHeader: TSA at JFK are horrible people
reviewContent: The TSA at JFK are horrible people. Everyone is trying to comply with their demands but they shout and are verbally abusive and throw things around. I am American and used to the appalling behavior of a lot of the agents. I am ashamed that this is the impression visitors receive of America. We are so strictly told how and where to move in passport lines to enter from a foreign trip then the TSA bullies yell if you don’t do the opposite and move to form new lines quickly. It’s just appalling. Why do customers of airlines deserve to be treated like criminals?

I know all airports are expensive but $5.49 for water and $14.99 for jack links jerky! $40 for a charger - all in all this airport has cost me with 2 children $140 for a charger, food and beverages! It’s really not ok, we pay extortionate prices for the flights, plus baggage now and then the airport are doing daylight robbery! It’s not fair And really shows the level of greed for these multi million dollar business’. Oh and please do not call your Duty free ‘Duty Free’ when the alcohol is the same price in a U.K. Tesco and we’re supposed to be the expensive country! I really hope to not have to use this airport in the future.

Female agent barking orders to put items in trays and place on belt. As there were only a stack of white ones everyone started grabbing and using them. Once several people had placed trays on belt she then stated yelling at them to put the white trays back and wait for more grey ones to arrive. She them singled out an older Indian gent and yelled at him non stop for little things until he passed all the way through and even rolled her eyes at him and started bad mouthing him to another agent, really sad and disgusting.  I know this job is thankless but there has to be other ways to get your kicks and feel self important.

Airport staff waiting at the line for Global Entry - woman working 1pm on 12/3/2024 needs to be trained. There were no back ups in the queue and when my Face ID didn’t work she proceeded to yell at me saying I didn’t have it (when I know full well that I do and have used it 7 + times in the past 2 years). She proceeded to scream over and over that I didn’t have it and the border patrol gentleman was nice enough to signal to me that there was a line I could go to to see what the issue was with it not picking up my Face ID. Technology is not prone from error and this woman was not trained and unnecessarily rude and assumptive for no reason. There was no one even waiting on me with 5-6 machines wide open. Please train your staff.

Terrible! The ESTA line is not moving, there are 1-2 customs officers here in total, who are as slow as a snail. Some are taken out of line, so the others do not progress. 2 meters in an hour. Ridiculous and requires serious remedial action. Air is not moving.

You need to train TSA agents at this location on true American hospitality and common human decency. TSA staff was extremely rude. They yelled at travelers, waived at them to move through lines with insulting hand gestures that showed impatience, abrasiveness, and disrespect. One agent dropped the buckets on the floor in front of everyone to show them she was unhappy about how the buckets were supposed to be lined up. The TSA agent verifying passports at the entrance was rude taking pictures answering questions with sarcastic and condescending comments to travelers who asked for clarification. It is not like there was a huge line or there were lot of travelers. Most of the end rows were empty. So the excuse that this is a busty airport and that TSA agents have to deal with lot of travelers will not fly in this case. I have gone through this airport many times in the past and I think the service at the international level is getting worse. Yes most travelers are immigrants and their level of English language knowledge could be limited but that is an excuse to bark at people and treat them like dirt. Not in America anyway.

JFK is the worst airport ever. The staff is unfriendly and the waiting times are unbearable. How can such a big airport have such garbage service and border control. It’s ridiculous. Think twice before flying JFK.

commentHeader: security scanning was a complete shambles
reviewContent: After a disappointing immigration experience, on departure to UK, the security queue was long but did move reasonably, however the security scanning was a complete shambles. We got through but what a fiasco.

commentHeader: 1.5 hrs in line waiting for immigration
reviewContent: Spent 1.5 hrs in line waiting for immigration, 5 officers to process 100's of passengers. Immigration officer was so miserable. Terrible experience.

Extremely rude TSA agent at Arrivals, Terminal 7 Mobile Passport Control Line on October 20, 2023. This guy must have felt he was on some power trip and made a point to be as rude and condescending as possible because I didn't hear his question. It didn't matter that he was talking very low, the area was busy with arriving passengers. I have never encountered anyone this unprofessional at JFK (and the bar is already low there). He even had a nerve to suggest I was talking over him. What a poor representation of TSA for arriving US Citizens.

Horrible experience. I landed on a flight from London, heading to a connecting flight to Minneapolis. We cleared customs but signs for connecting flights departures were not apparent/user friendly. Staff guided us to an area that eventually mixed with an area where new arrivals could merge. This meant that we had to go through security/x-ray screening all over again. If they had guided through an area of the airport that was still contained within the airport we would not have had to repeat screening, as we had already been screened at our last airport. The line for screening moved extremely slowly, perhaps due to being understaffed? Several of us were concerned about missing connecting flights, I almost missed mine despite having a 2 hour layover. I had to race to the gate and made it just in time to be one of the last people on the flight. I didn't even have enough time to grab a cup of coffee or use the bathroom. Very bad experience.

TSA rude and careless, barking orders and unhelpful. My items were dumped and scattered in various trays and people honestly don’t care. I will avoid this airport in future. With your reviews awful, you really need to have some care training. I am a senior citizen and treated very inequitably.

commentHeader: goes from disgraceful to utterly disgusting
reviewContent: This airport goes from disgraceful to utterly disgusting. Not only is the staffing for immigration clearance so poor - this is the second time in 2 months I’ve waited over 2 hours but the staff did not stop the cheats from going round via US Citizen queue then walking across and cutting the line. Complaints fell on uninterested staff who shrugged their shoulders. I will try avoid this airport as much as possible. What a horrible advert for a country when’s its main airport is such a shambles.

commentHeader: really leaves a sour taste in your mouth
reviewContent: I never have much of an issue departing from this airport, but the line attendants for passport control on arrival are always rude. It really leaves a sour taste in your mouth. The passenger in front of me was an older Hispanic woman - she was walking a little slowly, getting her papers and passport together, but there was nobody behind us and I could tell she was older, so I didn’t mind. The line attendant rudely said “let’s go!” To her and then immediately asked her if she was a green card or visa holder - I’m assuming because of her race? It turned out she was an American citizen (duh - we were in the US Citizen line). The attendant just kept barking commands at her and giving her no time to answer any questions. Then she starts barking at me and just being really patronizing. I’ve seen similar behavior multiple times from passport control line attendants when arriving from an international flight.

Absolutely awful experience at this airport! After an amazing 5 night stay in NYC with my family, our holiday quickly turned sour when going through security here. If the 1 hour queue wasn't bad enough, being greeting by shouting security officers made it the worst experience we've ever had in an international airport. I can't single just the one security official out, they were all aggressive, abrupt, and completely unprofessional. This must be in the training, as it was quite consistent throughout. I could add a little assistance if anyone from JFK is reading this. Instead of saying "if I see those phones in your hands I'm pulling you to one side" perhaps say "could everyone please place their phones in the trays provided". Its just a little common courtesy, and plain good manners, and you'd be surprised how far it gets you in life. The whole experience has actually put us off coming back to New York again. Which is a shame, as we really enjoyed it. I was emptying my bag of my laptop and tablet at which time the lady took it from me and put it in a tray, and told me to take my shoes off. I said my laptop is in there and she looked at me with a steely gaze and said "I know.....take your shoes off". Honestly it was just horrendous. Herded through like cattle and shouted at. The whole airport needs massive improvement, and lessons in basic decorum.

Simply awful and frustrating. We were almost missing our connecting Flight despite around 5 hours of transit time. Running and sweating because of unbelievable queing at passport control first and then unbelievable hundred and hundred meters of queue. Laziest staff ever experienced, they don t care nothing about pax, repeating same controls several times, only very few security staff for thousands of passengers, quite rude and totally against passengers. No transit area, no connection line, no way to send bags to final destination. I will never never fly to or via JFK in the future. Shame on Airport authority and tsa and staff working there.

This is by far the worst airport I have ever had the misfortune to travel through. The security staff are the laziest, most rude individuals imaginable and the security system is like something out of the dark ages. How this airport has the cheek to carry the name of such a great man is beyond me - shameful. Would put me off ever coming back to New York!

Despicable experience. People pushed around in a very long line as though they are animals. Women standing with little babies in their hands for hours and no one giving them priority! The whole security experience is the worst I have seen in any airport in the world. What is the JFK management doing? They should be fired for humiliating JFK passengers, who are their clients. Stop following modern standards of service, this airport has a really unpleasant, almost fascist feeling. This is serious. I was in terminal 4.

commentHeader: TSA staff are so abrupt and rude
reviewContent: TSA staff are so abrupt and rude. The gentleman at the scanner told me me to pull up my pants...My pants were just fine (Im a 36 man, not a teenager) I asked him "should I pull up my pants". Then proceeds to say "yeah you heard that correctly, pull up your pants bro, pull up your pants bro", when I walked I said "no need to be rude" to which he said, "step out, bye". Not sure in what world is it acceptable to talk to people like that

Miserable experience. Security personnel were mouthy and rude and pushed people through security so quickly that it caused a large group of people trying to get themselves and their belongings back together while security personnel kept screeching, “move down, this is a working area.” There was only one bench and one small table and no room for people to put their shoes on, belts on, re-pack electronics etc. and there were only TWO agents screening hundreds of people. The process was so slow that we missed our connecting flight and had to spend the night in the airport which was freezing cold even in July. It also irks me that people cannot speak English clearly which causes more confusion and frustration. I loathe this airport and will avoid it at all costs in the future.

The TSA staff at JFK and the gate staff need a huge amount of training in customer service and process. Going through T7, a whole load of us experienced one particular TSA officer shouting instructions about what goes where in the trays and rather than do their job, which is to repeat the information, they decided to go up to people and shout at them in a tone as if the person is an idiot and then turn to the queue and say “see, they just don’t listen”, so everyone can look at you like you’re a criminal. Airports all over the world have different rules for security screening. Frequent flyers will often automatically go to the majority format, it’s not malicious and it definitely doesn’t deserve being made to be the focus of derision. The gate staff called people holding a mobile boarding pass to have their ID verified AGAIN at the gate, before the boarding process started. When asked why, rather than tell the truth, they said that’s the rules. It wasn’t the rule when flying out of JFK literally a couple of weeks ago and it still is not the rule. Mobile boarding pass holders do not require additional ID screening at the gate and this member of staff was not accurate. The process for ID verification is stated as follows: “The officer will insert each photo ID into the CAT unit where the ID is scanned and analyzed. CAT is linked electronically to the Secure Flight database, which confirms travelers' flight details, ensuring they are ticketed for travel that day.” Really poor travelling experience.

Don't ever fly through JFK if you have to go to New York city! Standing in queue for 4 hours along with 500 other passengers at JFK Airport customs was a harrowing experience. Can you imagine just 3 immigration inspectors for 500 passengers? The last thing I wanted after a long flight and fatigued legs was to be held up at immigration for an inordinate amount of time. All I wanted to do was rest, refresh and resume. Here I was waiting in JFK security lines.

This is the worst connecting flight experience I've ever encountered. We needed to collect our bags and go through border patrol/re-check bags/security. This in itself wouldn't be a problem if the airport was sufficiently manned and the process wasn't so slow. We landed into JFK at 5.45pm, our connecting flight was at 8.05pm. When coming off the plane we followed the signs for non USA citizens and stood queuing for 45 mins for passport control. It was only when we got near the front of the queue we realised there is a 'quick connect' queue for people on connecting flights. This isn't visible or well signposted until you are at the front of the queue, there were no staff directing. You would have to walk passed the 'Non USA Citizens' queue to see it. Even once we switched to that queue (as the other had stagnated completely) it still took an additional 30 mins. There was one border officer who had to take prints and pictures of every passenger. It wasn't something that can be done quickly and I understand why, however more staff would help. Once through there our bag collection was quick and easy, so that was a positive.  From there we followed signs for connecting passengers. We re-checked the bags which was quick for us. We headed for security, there is a specific security for connecting passengers. The queue was long but not overly long, the issue was again how slow it was. They had one belt open for all connecting flights. After 30 mins of queuing here, our family and others made it known to airport staff that due to the length of time queuing we were going to miss our flight. We had 30 mins until take off, others had even less. A lady who tried to be helpful took us to the front and asked security staff if we could go through as a priority as we were going to miss our flights, unfortunately she was told no. There was a belt for 'TSA' passengers that was empty, they were unwilling to let people use it despite the lady pleading with them on our behalf. I'd like to thank her, I don't know her name but she tried to help and got a hard time from others because of it. Another worker would let parties of 2 jump to the front but not us as we were a party of 4. It was so frustrating being refused help yourself to have others jump in front, making us more likely to miss our flight. After 45 mins of some passengers pleading for priority to get through and one young woman crying her eyes out because she was missing her plane, they decided opening a second belt was a good idea. After a 1 hour queue at security, we got through with 10 mins to go. We sprinted shoeless through the airport to our gate, the airport is huge so it was quite a way. We made it just in time. The icing on the cake was when we arrived at our final destination and all 4 of our bags had been left in New York. The only saving grace was that we did make our flight, despite it being an unnecessarily stressful situation. My advice is, if possible don't connect here. If you do, make sure you have 3 hours minimum to do it in case the service is as bad as it was for us. Look for the 'Quick Connect' queue at passport control if you are on a connecting flight.

JFK is arguably my least favorite airport, but I was pleasantly surprised with my experience this time. The check in and security process was exceptionally quick as I was able to get to my gate in less than an hour! I was also not expecting the TSA to be so accommodating considering my own past experiences at JFK dealing with their rudeness. There were a decent amount of food options, but most were charging pretty steep prices so the McDonald’s and Dunkin’ Donuts were a godsend. Ultimately, JFK’s biggest advantage is the range of destinations you can fly to directly, it’s not an aesthetically pleasing airport with world class amenities but at least this time was far less stressful. This was also my first time flying out of Terminal 4 so I feel the experience really varies based on the terminal.

Worst airport I have ever been in. Terminal 8 security task employees were slow, rude and disrespectful. My husbands bag got detained and the young man checking it was arrogant and rude. I’ll never use the airport again for international travel.

commentHeader: arrival experience at JFK is dreadful
reviewContent: Given the lengthy international flight times to NYC and the exciting prospect to a traveller of seeing one of the world's most exciting destinations, the arrival experience at JFK is a dreadful advert for the USA. The airport is old, poorly designed and needs knocked down. Passport control and security is almost third-world, crowds being shepherded in their hundreds (after a long walk) into one huge hall and processed at a snail's pace (two hours in my case after after a 13-hour flight). No respite if you are a child, or old or disabled. It is quite simply, a devastatingly unpleasant experience. The wi-fi is poor, signage is poor, the exits are small, there are not enough restrooms, the lack of amenities is endless. Departure is marginally better but not enough security machinery to process quickly. The shops are not great in quality and everyone just looks disappointed! This airport does not feel or look clean. What a shame that this (last-century) airport is the gateway to an amazing city. Next time it will be Newark!

commentHeader: Not a single staff member to control crowds
reviewContent: Horrendous - the only way to describe the immigration system. Last night, T8, total chaos. No way to even join a queue initially as was insanely busy. Free for all. Not a single staff member to control crowds. Took 2 hrs 40 mins to get through in cramped stifling conditions. Not fit for purpose. Unlike other airports, no e-gates. Welcome to America? Last time I came via Dublin with Aer Lingus was brilliant where you pre-clear immigration.. The only way to do this trip in future.

TSA agents might want to consider that customers may be having a bad day and could try a little kindness. JFK has the rudest, meanest agents I have ever encountered. Will fly through Laguardia in the future.

This airport is absolutely chaotic and not up to date! Everywhere in New York City it's possible to enter the subway with a credit card. Arriving at the airport you have to buy a metro card (long queues!) for an air train, that doesn't even reach every terminal. Totally embarrassing! To reach terminal 1, you have to switch to a crowded bus, that takes 8 minutes to the terminal, which is about 50 meters away. What the heck? I cannot believe this chaos! Never ever again!

Arriving after a 14 hour flight at JFK from Seoul, the plane waited on the tarmac for 25 minutes, the immigration hall was full to overflowing and it took 70 minutes in a winding line to get through to the full luggage hall. But much worse to come! The SkyTrain at Terminal 1 is out of action and the buses to the Sky train at terminal 8 were insufficient to handle the crowd so it was another hour in a line waiting for the shuttle and then a dangerously full bus to terminal 8 and then more time waiting for the SkyTrain. More than 3 hours from touch down to arrival at the hotel bus stop. Totally unacceptable.

As a frequent traveller, this is probably the worst airport experience of my life. On June 17th at around 08.30 PM I went through security at Terminal 7 to take my flight. The person driving the queue gave confusing indications, and when people rightfully expressed their confusion, she reacted with a snobbish attitude or by yelling at them. Once arrived to the scanners, the person supposed to instruct passengers about what to take out of their bags kept yelling at everyone, saying she was angry because people did not listen - maybe she forgets that the airport is also used by people who don´t speak the language, or by people who can´t hear, or by unexperienced travellers. This made us and the other passengers around us extremely uncomfortable, and I was personally shocked by such disturbing behaviour. I am a young and healthy traveller who will probably forget this experience in a few weeks, but for elderly passengers or first-time travellers this could be unsettling or traumatising.

I come through here every week for work and, today I damned near cried from the agent in terminal 7. Why does everyone yell, why would you have such mean, anxiety inducing individuals work here. They mix regular and, TSA customers together and, then yell at you to take your shoes off, take your laptop out, dont question it or they will flip out on you. I felt like I had to calm the agent down.

The airport facilities are extremely dirty. Airport and TSA staff are VERY unfriendly and unprofessional. We tried to ask for information and received a snobby remark and bad attitude. We had a short transfer time due to a delay in our inbound flight to JFK. We had asked the airport personnel for any assistance to expedite our way to our next flight and the remark one gets back is "that is not our problem, we don´t care." I am now trying to always avoid this dirty unprofessional airport. Keep in mind we were traveling with a kid and it was his first time in New York and he says he never wants to return to this airport. Shame on them really.

Without a doubt, JFK is the worst airport I have ever arrived into or departed from. For a country that prides itself on customer service, the staff in this airport are the epitome of exceptionally bad and rude behaviour. I have never witnessed such appalling rudeness and arrogance from TSA staff. Their air of superiority is second-to-none and their blatant disrespect of passengers and their belongings is unparalled. TSA staff, in general, tend to be obnoxious but the staff in JFK are the outright winners. The TSA staff add significant stress, worry and anxiety to many passengers who are already nervous travellers which is dreadful considering the ongoing mental health crisis at the moment. These staff need to be either fired or retrained into non-customer-facing roles. Truly, truly dreadful. Failing that, the leadership and management of TSA need to spend some time with the staff on the ground to witness their unrelenting rudeness, and subsequently introduce customer service training.

I’ve used this airport before and didn’t have any major problems until my connecting international flight. Our flight arrived later than planned and they had us wait in the airplane for additional time. This had us scrambling through immigration and TSA even with being allowed to rush to the front of the line due to our flight boarding. By the time we made it back to departures, our terminal, and our gate the doors had closed. Immigration had only a few people working the line causing it to move slow. Everyone was packed into one line until one of the officers started to finally ask for US citizens with US passports to form another line. TSA was not helpful at all other than a few people letting us know to rush forward. Very dirty, busy and expensive with too many employees who aren’t so helpful. International connecting flights with short layover especially if the flight is behind should have some type of marker on their tickets or a line to make things faster for them since we cannot control wait times.

Horrible TSA, literally the worst I’ve been to in a first world country. We stood inline for 45 mins then they took us downstairs where we had to wait for another 30mins and I ended up missing the flight. I know nothing can be done but gosh is this airport horrible. Also the Air Train took forever to leave.

Immigration is slow and total chaos. The ladies I encountered in security, were so rude, swearing at customers, name calling. No wonder they score so low consistently. You might be a metropolitan international city, but JFK is worse than any low-key third world country, fix it!

Comparable to 3rd world countries. The complete lack of technology and slow manual checks on arrival are totally unacceptable. There were no electronic security checks of passports, purely an excruciating long queue of thousands of people which was poorly managed by very few staff and manual antiquated methods. Very difficult to navigate round the airport at times due to tiny & unclear signs. Not what one would expect of New York.

TSA staff completely rude and unhelpful. I was traveling with my 2 children who speak no English, and they were being sent to a different X-Ray machine than I was. They were terrified, but TSA couldn't care less. Upon the arrival at the airport, on the Monitor the boarding Gate displayed was number 10, but on the printed boarding Pass was number 7. I asked the check-in staff what was the correct gate and they confirmed me it was number 7. When I arrived at gate 7, the flight that was going to board there was for Vienna and I was flying to Lisbon. I then Proceeded to Gate 10, which was shown on the monitor, and the boarding told me that it was on gate 1. Thankfully in that same instant on gate 10 monitor showed up my flight and I stayed there in gate 10. While I was writing this review my flight was delayed 40 minutes, hopefully it won't delay anymore. Fingers crossed. JFK? NEVER AGAIN

We arrived hours before our connecting flight but getting through customs took over an hour. We then got our bags and we’re getting them checked but after waiting in the line for customs for so long they said we couldn’t get our bags checked or get on the plane because it was 50 minutes before the departure and they needed our bags 60 minutes before. We then had to wait in line for almost 2 hours to reschedule our flight because literally everyone flying on our airline was screwed over. The workers there were the most unhelpful, rude people and after pleading with them for 30 minutes we were able to book a flight over 24 hours later. Everyone else in line was also in the same boat, trying desperately to find a new flight while the workers basically did nothing. I genuinely hope to have the luxury of never returning to this airport. This was a horrible way to end a lovely vacation. I hope everyone else in the airport was able to figure something out because god knows the staff there wasn’t going to do anything.

commentHeader: 3 hours before we got through passport checks
reviewContent: Even though our flight from London Heathrow arrived 1 hour early we still queued for more than 3 hours before we got through passport checks. It was an utter shambles with hundreds of people waiting to go through and collect luggage. More flights were arriving and the number of passengers waiting to be processed just got bigger. At no point was there any explanation why we were being held up (obviously due to staff shortages) staff that were there were rude and unhelpful. We were in this queue with a 15month old baby, no allowance given. One man in the queue who had arrived with his disabled wife was still made to wait whilst they fast tracked his wife who was then left stranded on the other side! It was crazy. There was never any update regarding how long we were going to have to wait, subsequently transport that we had booked left. Returning to UK was slightly quicker but still a shambles. Disorganised to say the least! Marred our visit to NYC.

I have traveled extensively with work to Asia, China the far east and Europe, I have never experienced anything worse than JFK, the staff are so rude and arrogant, really spoilt our experience of New York. We will try Newark next time

commentHeader: thank you, JFK, for ruining my experience
reviewContent: I must have been the dumbest person in the world to give this airport a second chance. If you have read my first review, you know that JFK got off on a rocky start. I would say that my experience was slightly better. There was one woman in particular who cared about people. She thought I was on my own so she stopped her traffic job to ask me where the driver was. I took that as a kind act. Some staff was rudely telling people to move up, and one woman actually had the sense to YELL at a family. Are you kidding me? Thankfully, India takes connections, and we didn't have to take JFK for everything, but it was our final stop. When I went to use the bathroom, I was in shock. There was a water bottle in the urinal. The floor had some sort of water that I was unsure of. I pushed the red button on the feedback thingy. I really thank you, JFK, for ruining my experience. We are going to Punta Cana in Autumn, and we are certainly not associating with this place!

Absolutely disappointed in the manner how the security check is handled. No communication skills, not polite. I had a lotion in my bag which was slightly too big according to the standards. Not a problem, BUT: The security guy was looking for this lotion by taking everything out from my bag. I said to him that I can let him know where it is if he can let me know what he looks for. I was completely ignored. When he found it, I asked him not to touch my personal belongings anymore and I would pack it back myself, he completely ignored me. He stuffed all things back and stepped away. No communication skills whatsoever. How difficult it is to be polite and communicate? On a last note: The Netherlands has already greater systems for scanning, without taking anything out of bags. Liquids are also allowed because they can check through the screens what kind of liquids it is. This makes customer service million times better.

commentHeader: Will never fly through JFK again
reviewContent: Once again, JFK management proves that there is absolutely no concern for their travelling clients. Hundreds of travellers lined up for customs with only two processing agents. Even these left periodically with travellers, leaving nobody to continue processing. 3h in line. When we finally moved through, we entered the security lineup, which kept being held up because there were only 4 agents manning scanners. Meanwhile, customers were being moved ahead as their flights were departing imminently… leaving more of us in our own danger of missing our connections. Total disrespect and disregard for the reality of their customers. Will never fly through JFK again.

commentHeader: we will avoid JFK at all cost
reviewContent: When we landed at terminal 4, we were given a gate in terminal 2 for our domestic flight. That’s where we went immediately. Terminal 2 is in terrible condition, with overpriced and disgusting food options. We have traveled extensively. This is our worst food experience. If it was only that, it would not warrant feedback. What really, REALLY got to us is the impromptu change of terminal for our domestic. Flight mid-afternoon, about three hours before departure. We were to move back to terminal four. Once again, we complied without delay, and we were right! 45-50 minutes wait were announced. It took us over an hour. That was so because of the unmanaged merging of two wait lanes to access security checks. Following that, the TSA employee asked to see the kids’ passports (they are both under 11), which has never happened any other place. We have passports for them. Most people do not. Finally, actually getting our belongings on the scanner was a free for all encouraged by the TSA employee. Overall, when at all possible, we will avoid JFK at all cost.

Terminal 8 is by far the worst of all within JFK. The most rude, unprofessional and unhelpful TSA security people I’ve ever come across. After taking my jacket off at security, I then got berated for not wanting to take my jumper off as well (other travelers were not being asked to do the same). I’ll avoid traveling American ever again as clearly customer service at their terminal isn’t important.

My friend and I came in from traveling from SE Asia and we had packed some duty free items from Dubai airport. Unfortunately, it was not prepared per US airport standards so we needed to shuffle during security to get it into a bag to be checked in. Thankfully Silina from security took her time to safely pack our glass goods and escorted my friend to check the bag in and safely get it wrapped. She was so pleasant to deal with and made for a good experience for traveling 24 hours.

commentHeader: Terminal 5 is probably one of the worst terminals
reviewContent: Terminal 5 is probably one of the worst terminals to depart from. The noise level, neon lights and lack of quiet space or comfortable seating area create extremely stressful environment. It doesn’t help that it is populated with inexperienced holiday travelers. Perhaps, JetBlue or terminal management should give more thought to how improve the human experience rather than focus on flashy exterior l. Terminal 5 brings down all the positive aspect of flying with JetBlue. Other JetBlue terminals at BOD, SFO to name a couple are so much better.
Very rude staff. Lack of seating in the departure area, having to sit on the floor for quite a few hours. Would not recommend flying from this airport. Lots of people so it does get busy

commentHeader: staff rude, lazy and lacking any kind of professionalism
reviewContent: I found the departure security staff rude, lazy and lacking any kind of professionalism. They were the worst I have ever experienced. They were extremely slow at dealing with carry on bags that had to be rechecked. It was like they were purposely trying to be slow and annoying. The managers present seemed to encourage this behaviour.

Terrible airport/Disappointing airport I arrived on 25 November on a Friday which was the thanksgiving weekend. Common sense will let management know there will be a lot of travelers but as I landed at 5:10am and ended up leaving the line at almost 9:00am. Before I even joined the line at the customs I could overhear a airport personnel shouting at a traveler who was confused as to where the line starts that “this is not a jungle”. Which was very rude in my opinion. The line had at least 800 people in it. The WiFi didn’t work at the airport, it was 9 degrees Celsius outside but I was sweating in the line. The infrastructure looked old and duty and rusty. I was standing the whole 3 hours on just this one line no where to seat down .. they had to pull people who had connecting flight of the line because obviously they were going to miss it. There was just 3 or 4 customs officers working and at an extremely low pace to the extent when one person was finally processed by an officer the crowd gave a sarcastic clap. Simply put JFK is a nightmare and is in need for a serious upgrade especially with its personnel

We had JFK as a stop over on our way home to California. It was our only option. We have never flown into JFK and did not know the set up and how the terminals are set up. We arrived at terminal 8 with 40 mins to get to our next plane. We had to go to Terminal 5. When we got off the plane, I asked at the ticket area where Terminal 5 was and she said follow green signs to the airtrain and then 2 stops. Ok, great we thought that sounds like no problem. We followed the green signs for 25 mins and then security told us we would have to keep following signs and then go out and back in and go through security again after the airtrain! What? Really. We explained that our next plane was boarding already and they shrugged their shoulders and turned their backs. When I asked before, no one told us we would need to go thru security again. At security, we explained our plane was boarding and we had just gotten off one plane and they just shrugged and laughed and wouldn't help. After another 25 mins in security, we made it to our gate as they were closing the door. Thanks for nothing American and JetBlue!

Not a very friendly airport. We were flying a few weeks ago on Delta Airlines. When we got to the airport, a man needed help with his baggage tag. The woman groaned and said, “Ughhhhh!” While we were going through Security, a woman told a man rudely to move up, he asked where. The woman raised her voice and said, “Over here!” Then she loudly sighed and slapped her knee. I understand that it was 6 am at the crack of dawn but it is no excuse to take it out on customers! On our way back from our vacation, I was going to give the airport another chance when a woman rudely told the drivers at the stop to move up. Despite these rude people at the airport, there were nice people. My father asked the lady at baggage security if she could change her glove because she touched other suitcases, she kindly said, “Of course!” Well, you can thank the people that pushed me to write this 4/10 star review. We will be taking another vacation to India soon and needless to say we will be flying out of elsewhere!

The JFK airport is disgusting and only manages to get worse. Some of the terminals are completely dilapidated and isolated. Your options for decent food or even a non-gross bar to sit and grab a drink at are sparse. Apparently, New York State and City taxes, which total to be in line with the Nordic countries, just aren’t high enough. Disgusting.

commentHeader: avoid this airport in the future
reviewContent: I hope this review will be helpful for international travelers who need to make a domestic connecting flight at JFK airport. I had to travel from terminal 1 to terminal 8 and was scammed by a lady wearing security airport outfit. She told me i was too late for my flight which was boarding in 55 mins. She said the train depart every 30 mins and i should have take the shuttle to terminal 8. End up the shuttle was her personal car and i wad charged $97 for cash and $108 for card. This is my first time transit at this airport and i have no idea about the departure time of the train. I cant belive that the airport allows scammers stay inside and scam travelers who are new to this airport and dont have enough information about transportation. I will definitely avoid this airport in the future.

On Monday, October 24, 2022, my husband and I arrived at JFK for our flight to Calgary. At the WestJet check-in counter we asked for a wheelchair as my husband has trouble walking long distances. The woman there was very accommodating, and they brought us a plastic type of wheelchair (JetWheel?). She wheeled my husband a short distance and said to wait for an agent to come. We waited over half an hour. It looked as though she was trying to contact someone. Finally, an older man came, walking very slowly, and looking very uninterested in pushing the wheelchair. However, the woman urged him to hurry, and he proceeded to push the wheelchair, cutting through the security line in a couple of places to get to the security check. This is where we had a very troubling experience, The young woman on security started yelling at the agent who was pushing the wheelchair, telling him to empty his pockets. He told her he didn't have anything in his pockets, She kept yelling at him, and went on about how this happens every time. Then she started yelling at my husband to empty his pockets, to take the kleenex out of his pocket, etc. Other people were also going through security, and she's yelling at us, and there are no bins to put our things in, and our possessions are being thrown on the conveyer, some on the conveyer, some in different bins, some on the floor. It was total bedlam. This woman should not be working there. She was totally unprofessional, extremely disrespectful, and it was totally uncalled for. When we finally got through this area, the agent started pushing the wheelchair. I was very angry and upset by this time, and asked him to stop. I had no idea if we had collected everything, and I needed to assess what was what. It turned out that we did not have my husband's iPhone. Another security person, a man, started looking, and came up with an object. It wasn't our phone but a medical device that we needed. I said that we still did not have our phone. Finally, he finds it. Still not sure if we got everything. It was like a nightmare. I suspect that they may have a purpose to their bedlam. I wonder how many phones, etc. they end up with, after terrorizing the passengers going through. The agent then took us to a gate, and was ready to leave us when luckily I decided to verify that it was the correct gate. It wasn't. He said he was very sorry, and I do think it was an honest mistake. He then took us to the correct gate which was a long ways away. We would not have been able to walk it. The agent that pushed the wheelchair said that the woman at security was "mean" and was always like that, and was always attacking him. Is there no supervision at this major American airport? I noticed similar stories in many of the reviews. This was a very disturbing experience for my husband and I - both seniors. One would think there would be some kind of accountability.

Worst Airport in NYC - even worse than Newark. I’m so glad United is stopping service from JFK. I’d gladly trek to Jersey than go to JFK. The TSA employees are completely incompetent. There was a male TSA employee who told all the female passengers to stand on one side just because their female TSA employee wasn’t available for pat-down. Like as if most passengers need a pat-down? And even when she was available, he still asked us to wait on one side and let all the male passengers go through security. Also, only 3 food choices at Terminal 7. Expect a 20-30 min wait at a Dunkin Donut.

commentHeader: Avoid this place at all cost
reviewContent: Worse airport ever. Employees are rude, do not hesitate to yell at people for no reason. Have to go to TSA check again for a connecting international flight. Prepare yourself to wait in line for at least 1h. This is so unnecessary. If you bough any liquid (alcohol bottle, oil, etc) at the duty free of the previous airport, it will be confiscated by TSA. They yell at my 10 years old son for not being fast enough to put his bag into the bin. A TSA guy rudely told a lady in front of me who was not understanding what he was asking to her: "are you really deciding to mot listen to me today!". Avoid this place at all cost. I will never transit here anymore since it seems to be a chronic issues with no desire to fix it.

Horrible experience. No signs giving directions. If you took the most obvious route out of the baggage recheck area for arriving international flights, you ended up in a terminal where you had to go through security again. This was another nightmare. The place was full of CLEAR staff trying to get you to sign up so you could "skip the line," Okay, that sounds like a good idea. On attempt to sign up, we saw we already were enrolled in CLEAR.  They're not going to get a commission or meet their quote with us, so they direct us to an area in the line. Only problem was they wouldn't let us enter the CLEAR line (I'm not sure there even was one as every time I have attempted to utilize this option, I have ended up in the line of cattle on the way to slaughter). The line was endless and no signage indicating the regular line from TSA precheck (which we had printed on our boarding pass). Upon finally arriving at the checkpoint, my traveling companion was severely reprimanded to not being in the precheck line. Believe me, she would have been if there had been one that could have been identified. Simply put, no directions, rude staff, no one in charge to direct traffic and alleviate a crowded situation that could have been lessened by a simple bit of organization and human decency all combined made this one of the most horrible experiences of my life. CLEAR is a joke, JFK is a joke and any travel through this airport has become the number 1 airport in the US to avoid.

commentHeader: see why this airport is rated so bad
reviewContent: As we had a package deal it meant that we had a long time to wait in in JFK airport before we could even drop our bags. When we arrived very disappointed to find only desks for checking, no toilets, no shops, nothing. By going down two levels to the arrivals area we located a shop and a dunking donuts and toilets very poor. Once we got thought passport control great choice of stores and places to eat but at airport prices - can see why this airport is rated so bad.

commentHeader: Terminal 1 for intl departure is awful
reviewContent: Terminal 1 for intl departure is awful. Hot stinky cramped. Upon return, helpers at customs are rude, horribly trained and unprofessional. Upon leaving the airport there's at least 20 men inside the terminal soliciting for illegal taxis. I plan to steer clear of New York JFK for the reminder of my intl travel.
3 hours wait in the immigration. Usually it is slow but this is a low point. Fly into other airports if you have connections. Also no information what so ever. Chaos.
Have been ripped off in the best airports in the world, but JFK take the biscuit, $23 for a bottle of water and a scabby sandwich. Profiteering at its best.

commentHeader: Shame on you, employees at JFK
reviewContent: What an awful way to begin a vacation. The employees, from weighing and checking our bags (scan didn’t work!) to having our id’s checked to going through security were nasty, rude, and unpleasant. They purposely mumbled and spoke so low that you couldn’t hear them and when you asked them to repeat they were SO COLD and NASTY. They looked miserable as if they didn’t want to be there. Then leave because you are making everyone else miserable! Robots would have been more pleasant. They barely looked at you and you were treated as sub-human. In contrast, the employees at CHS Airport we’re friendly, kind, and very pleasant. New York has a very bad reputation for being rude and disrespectful and JFK airport gives credence to this. I am ashamed that I live in a state where an airport is so horrific. I will no longer be taking flights from this horror of an airport. JFK employees should be fired and should be replaced with people who are happy and thankful to have a job in this precarious economic state. Shame on you, employees at JFK. You are a DISGRACE!

commentHeader: going above and beyond the call of duty
reviewContent: I was picking up my husband from arrivals at New York JFK airport. I was very nervous he wasn't feeling well he has diabetes and the family was concerned that he wasn't going to make it home okay. While I was waiting in front of the b area at terminal 4 I encountered a gentleman named Kenneth Hendricks. This gentleman assisted me in a way that was not only very professional but very compassionate I told him my husband had a pink knapsack and showed him a picture and it took him a little bit but he found my husband asked him if he was okay and brought them to me. Now if that's not going above and beyond the call of duty I don't know what is I do believe Kenneth should be acknowledged for the good service he provided us as customers.

Worst experience with the security control I have ever had. It is ok for things to go slow. But the staff were incredibly rude to 60% of the travelers. They expect all travelers to know the rules in and out like they do, which is impossible - especially because the signs with the rules are nok existing, or at least not easy to see. One of the staff were actually shouting to other travelers for not putting their bag correctly. It was actually very uncomfortable and I was not looking forward till it was my turn. Bad management. Bad staff..

The worst airport to exist. The staff is unprofessional, extremely rude (after missing our flight to LAX due to there being ONE slow security officer checking passports) and security, we changed our flight 2-3 times due to false information spread by the workers. The staff is so unfriendly, most of them on their phones. Not taking their job seriously, not willing to offer help or guidance, not doing anything at all.

commentHeader: worst passport check I have ever experienced
reviewContent: Consistently the worst passport check I have ever experienced. I fly between London and New York regularly and am consistently met with over 90 minute wait times just to get through passport control. There is normally only one person checking passports. Awful service, awfully run and and frustratingly inefficient.

commentHeader: TSA workers in this terminal are the worst
reviewContent: I flew out of terminal 7 on Alaskan airlines. The TSA workers in this terminal are the worst I’ve ever witnessed. Not only were they rude, disrespectful, and incredibly unfriendly, but they were throwing people’s belongings down the belt without even asking. It was also very unnecessary since people were pushing their bags down at a steady rate. When I asked why they were throwing my things, I was confronted by 2 TSA women who started arguing with me and saying “I was weird” I just don’t understand why they are allowed to get away with treating people like cattle… it’s TSA not secret service. Someone needs to address the issue that is constantly TSA employees attitude.

commentHeader: queue for passport control took over 2.5 hours
reviewContent: Arrived around 7pm on a BA flight from London. The queue for passport control took over 2.5 hours, just what you need after a long flight with kids. Flew back from Newark which was a breeze compared to JFK. Avoid at all costs.

We have been to JFK sometime back, but the most recent experience are the worst. We returned from Barcelona to LAX with a stop at JFK. We were given a tag for express-lane to pick up our luggage, go through custom and TSA. Unfortunately, the TSA staff mixed up the regular travelers with those with the "Express-Lane" to make the connecting flight. The TSA staff and customs staff have all appeared to be uninterested in their jobs as if they wished to be elsewhere. Chaos is evident everywhere. As a result, we ran and were barely made it to our flight to LAX - 5 minutes before the take off time. As if, the misery and stress was not enough, our plane was delayed and waited to take off due to 60 planes in front of our plane. We would avoid this airport at all cost in our future travel plan.

Simply terrible. Flew with AA and they had two counters open to check in and 200-300 passengers queing. All self check in desks were down and service was terrible. Security was even worse. Spent almost 2 hours to check in and get through security. After inspection there is little to no choice when it comes to eating. Literally two places which offered terrible options. I had to stand up at the gate since there are few steats (all of which were taken obviously).

It was a really bad experience to depart from Terminal 1 JFK Airport! Specifically security check was just terrible! Staff is rude, disrespectful and extremely unfriendly. I couldn't sleep well the nights after this bad experience, I was shocked by the behaviour of the security check staff. I cannot understand, that involved airlines put up with this circumstances for their passengers.

commentHeader: said that I had to leave the terminal
reviewContent: Arrived at JFK, terminal 1 around 11:30pm on the 8th of May, for the flight on the 9th. I laid myself down on the floor then I heard the voice saying that I was not allowed to ‘lie down on the floor.’ It was around 2am. So I woke up, and packed myself when the voice came up to me again to make sure. I moved on, looking for a bathroom and the voice called me again. She stopped me and asked where I was going. I said bathroom. She said that’s okay and told me direction to the bathroom, which was literally in front of me. She added that the Food Court was closed if I were to go there. First, I was not, and second, I knew it was closed anyway, but I did not bother to answer. After the bathroom, I started to looking for a new spot to sit down. Then I just thought that I might have a short breeze near the exit, but the door was closed. I waved my hand under the sensor once or twice then quit, and was about to resume my search for the chair. Then she ran up again and said the terminal was closed. I said I could see that, and asked her if she was following me. She said I was not allowed to roam around  the airport because the terminal was closed. But there were other people in the terminal! I said I was on my way to find a seat. She said I could sit anywhere, and I said I was on my way to the seat closer to my airline. She then said that I had to leave the terminal because my flight was to leave ‘tomorrow.’ It was 2:20am and my flight was 1pm, on the same day. She told me to leave immediately or she would call the police - she said it more than 5 times. I asked her what I was supposed to do, and she said I should leave immediately and come back after 6am. She blocking me with her body in case I go anywhere when I was not even moving. I hopped in the elevator as she said. I could see her calling someone with her wireless set to make sure I do not stay in the building. I landed on the 1st floor, with shock, horror and confusion. I tried to look up any hotels around the airport to go, but it took less than 30 seconds until the man, who got her call came up to me. He kindly advised me that the terminal 8 is open 24 hours. I asked him the direction, when she ran down to the first floor, cutting his words. She said “No, she’s not going to the third floor. Go out right here and walk across the street.” I said I would check with internet and she kept repeating that she would call the police. When I was waiting for the red light to change to green in front of the cross, I could see her watching me until I cross the street fully from inside. That was very creepy. It was 2:25am. Anyhow, I made it to the terminal 8, and guess what? There are so many people sleeping on the floor! Am I not allowed to come to the airport too early? I always thought that arriving in the airport earlier is always better than being late, but I guess this does not apply to JFK? I am just shocked and horrified that such a big international airport like JFK could kick an international guest like that manner.

commentHeader: Worst airport experience in the world
reviewContent: Worst airport experience in the world! When we arrived it was really crowded and we had to wait for more than 2 hours to have our passport controlled standing in line for all the time. The signs were not put in the right place, which had lead lots of passengers in the wrong line and the staff was really rude, not giving explanations or right indications. Restroom was dirty and we had a really bad experience with almost everything.

Probably the most horrific experience in my entire life. I boarded my flight from terminal 8 of JFK where I arrived 3 and half hours before flight. The airport was terribly overcrowded. Where in the world domestic and international passengers are checking in at same kiosks? A handful of highly uncooperative staff was available to help herd! of passengers at self-check-in kiosks so, I could not get any help in spite of literally begging from 3 staff when I was not able to scan my wife passport. Finally, one staff told me to go another counter. After standing in Queue for half an hour I was told that I was at wrong counter and should go to other counter. After standing in queue at that counter for 15 minutes, I was told that I should fill the immigration form of Peru by scanning QR code from the machine installed at a point in airport. I and at least 10 of other passengers were struggling to connect to Wi-Fi of airport to scan the code. When I went to some staff to report this issue their straight answer was “this issue is not their problem” and when I said that I will miss my flight, unfortunately instead of having a word of sympathy the answer was “it’s not their problem”. Anyways, I kept on trying for next half an hour to finally connect Wi-Fi of airport to find that it was not the “immigration form” it was “health declaration form” which I had already filled. Airport staff should at least know the exact terminology and difference between immigration form and health declaration form. Anyways, finally I stand in a long queue to find that I was not the only one, majority of the people in that line who like me were about to miss their flight or had already missed their flight in spite of reaching 3 hours prior due to utter chaos, incoordination and red tapism. I requested at least 3 staff to consider me early but in vain. Finally, I reached at check in counter to find that there was 1 pound extra in one bag (while other 3 bags were short of 30 pounds) but still the lady asked us to open our lock and shift our load to another bag. While we were doing so, she went for short break. The misery didn’t end here, security staff opened the bag of my wife to remove creams, lotions etc. (which we were open and were sure less than 100 ml; moreover, we had crossed 3 airports before in other countries with the same stuff). When I requested them to please do it little fast otherwise I will miss my flight, their answer was again “that’s not their problem” Finally, we sprinted to reach our flight departure gate which was about to close in next 5-10 minutes. At gate I was told that my cabin baggage is oversized (the same bag approved by check in staff became oversize after reaching at departure gate!). Anyways, finally we boarded our flight after depleting all adrenaline and other stress hormones. My request from authorities is:  At least separate domestic and international departures. Increase staff to help passengers at web check in kiosks. Ask staff to be compassionate towards passengers. Just bluntly saying that it not their problem does not solve the problem rather disheartens you. Start feedback system of international passengers to understand their agonies. Do a survey to find that how many international passengers are missing their flights and then compare with other countries.

JFK is a joke - from the redundant and thoughtless procedures, to the lack of useful signage when flying internally, to a staff that barely speak English, to the bar waitresses that add their own tip amounts to your food bill. Worst internal flying experience. I will fly out of my way and pay more to avoid this idiotic hell hole.

commentHeader: the worst airport I have ever visited
reviewContent: Without a doubt, this has to be the worst airport I have ever visited. The Airport itself was okay, but the staff is something else! From check-in to security to the stores, the staff were rude, unwelcoming, and disrespectful. On checking our luggage, they were systematically thrown onto the conveyor belt in front of our eyes. The security line was an absolute joke – here we had a couple of men who were shouting and barking orders at everyone and treated everyone as if they were incompetent. Security staff stood idly by and just watched as the security trays were becoming backlogged, thus creating more delays. I had to remove 6-8 of the trays myself in order to get the line moving. As to the staff within the stores and restaurants, well, a certain fast-food franchise should be ashamed of themselves. Have never been spoken so rudely in all my life. The staff of a certain fragrance store and Hudson News had no people skills whatsoever. They obviously didn’t want to be there.

Terrible experience. Zero seating in check in area so if your early no where to sit. Hand sanitizers are empty. Extremely confusing through security. People coming from all different lines into one very small area. No room, TSA seemed stressed trying to get people to stand in the right places because everyone was so confused. Good experience was awful too.

This was my absolute worst airport experience. Arrived from Heathrow and needed to transit to Nashville - we had a three hour window. Long story short we missed our connection due to the chaos at immigration. Out of 60 booths at times two were manned and they said there was a computer glitch which meant no non-US passengers were being processed. We queued for over two hours. Nobody cared. Delta staff were very helpful and we were transferred to a later flight. We had dinner in T4 and it was cold and the power went out What a disgrace and a terrible introduction to the US.

I was at JFK at my gate and had already gone through security checks. Waiting for my flight when cleaning crew came up to me and told me that I had to leave. I explained I had already been through security checkpoints ,I had my boarding pass they kicked me out and told me they were going to call the police on me because I was in the area that I should not of been in which was the gate 1 flight 7 Alaska to Seattle. They informed me that they did not have to wear masks since they were the cleaning crew. What a horrible experience.

commentHeader: been waiting for my luggage for close to an hour
reviewContent: I have been waiting for my luggage for close to an hour now. I think they really need to step it up in the baggage claim department. I have not seen 1 bag come down the conveyer belt for 30 minutes now. I don't think it's that hard to grab a bag and put it on the belt.

Utter shambles. I was in transit but baggage can't go through seamlessly, unlike at every other airport I have transited through. Security was a nightmare, not even trying to maintain any social distancing. The place is a health hazard.

commentHeader: helps their friend to skip the process
reviewContent: I'm TSA Pre Check traveler and I was surprised to see an Officer give special treatment to a couple by helping them skipped the lines. The way they were interacting it was obvious the knew each other, how can I feel secure when we a TSA helps their friend to skip the process, what else do they do? Everything else was good, TSAs are busy and working under a lot of stress, so they are stern and they don't need to be friendly and I'm ok with that.

Arrived from LAX at 12am with a 9 hour layover. Walked the entire terminal looking for a bottle of water. Not one beverage vending machine. Every vending machine I came across sold either Sim cards or headphones. I found one food vending machine but no beverages. If you don't save your empty water bottle you can't refill at the tap water fountains they do have, if you don't drink tap you will die of thirst until shops open at 6am.

Horrible, horrible experience. The flight was smooth and even arrived a few minutes early. But we had to wait 45 minutes for a gate to deplane, and then another hour for luggage to arrive at baggage claim. It’s just miserable. Stay away if you can.

Me and my husband arrived several hours late from our JetBlue flight, from Mexico, because of a delay. We were in Mexico & were told by the attendants numerous times that it wouldn't be much longer, only 15 more minutes. Instead of telling anyone the truth they had us all waiting around for HOURS. This was along with numerous others. Finally we boarded & arrived at JFK around 11pm and were told by the rude attendant that there was not another flight until 9:30 am, because we missed our flight. We told her it was of no fault of ours or anyone of the many others who arrived late due to JetBlues issue.
